alert.note: Alert for Pembina (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 10:06AM CDT until May 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pembina River at Neche. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, ND State Hwy 18 is inundated at Neche. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Sunday was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
